website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive, versatile rotary tool designed for occasional use. This complete kit is the best budget deal on the market.
cons: Occasional issues with component quality and durability

customer_reviews.title: Dremel 4485 collets work with WEN nut
customer_reviews.text: I have seen mixed reviews regarding the use of Dremel Collets with this tool. I will do my best to help clarify the compatibility, as the collet included with the tool might last 3 minutes of normal use. The dremel 4485 collets are slightly longer, however they do fit and seem to work. The nut included with the 4485 kit does not fit, I believe this is what the other reviewers were referring to in previous posts stating that the kit does not work. I have attached some photos showing the wen collet in brass and the dremel collets in aluminum. The other pictures show the dremel collet in the WEN tool and with the WEN nut installed.
customer_reviews.author: Silverstreak2076

customer_reviews.title: Defective - don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I purchased this to have one more flex shaft for when I have a lot of polymer clay beads to buff. I've put it together and the handle started heating up within 30 seconds. And you can't return it. If there was a "zero stars" that is what I would give them.
customer_reviews.author: Doina "Day" Berndt dba Kalyana Design

customer_reviews.title: Carved MESQUITE
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to wear my dremel out, so figured I'd try this WEN. I was impressed by how well it performed. If the video uploads you can watch me carve on a piece of Mesquite which had some imperfections. I've been using it on medium speed and have over 100 hours with no issues. Just be sure to do the following: keep the line straight, use the right bit for each job, give it rest every few min, don't apply heavy pressure and have fun! Follow ROCKING HORSE WOOD WORKS on Fbook and Instagram
customer_reviews.author: Ray H

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my nails. It took a bit to figure out how to put on the attachments but I got it working. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: CeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Utter trash
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I've ever ordered from Amazon. I was cutting a bolt down and the motor over heated and would not come on (I was controlling the speed and keeping it cool I was at it for 2 minutes). Before that the flexshaft came apart completely. The cut off wheels are horribly fragile. I placed it on the counter and it broke, figuring it was a fluke, I tried another, but I tapped this one to make sure it would not break upon contact and end up in my skin, a small flick broke it in 4 pieces. The sanding shaft bent on a 35° angle after 5 minutes of sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased & Incredible Service!
customer_reviews.text: I love my other WEN tools so I didn't hesitate when I had to replace my broken Dremel w/the new WEN 23114. Unfortunately shortly after receiving my new rotary tool it broke after just several minutes of running. A day or two later I wrote my review and although I love WEN products, I was somewhat disappointed that the new tool failed so quickly. Just a couple days later to my surprise I was contacted by Steve at WEN and was told they would be sending me out a new unit right away! Its the very impressive service like this makes me a WEN customer for life! Thanks again!!!
customer_reviews.author: BJM

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time and it does not keep a constant speed. It speeds up and down making it hard to use for much of anything. I am probably past the return date... shame on me for not using it as soon as I received it but I did not need it until today. Too good to be true for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful!! Could be dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous!! So I am very upset with this tool. Was very excited but then after maybe 5 days of use the cutting bit came flying off and litterally could have seriously injured or killed me. Luckily no one else was in the room. I thought maybe I didn't tighten it enough.... So I put the bit back on only to see as I was thightening the tool it was spliting apart - see the pic. Definitely returning. Hoping this is a fluke as I hate leaving negative reviews but this is a safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: Noiofnine

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Tool at Unbeatable Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this WEN rotary tool back in January and used it for several projects and to clean jewelry. I gotta say the thing is amazing and works like a champ. The price I paid for the tool was absolutely unbeatable. In fact, after holding and using the tool I thought the price was ridiculously low. I'd put this tool up against any of its name brand competitors any day. It is powerful, made well, easy to handle, comes with plenty of accessories and has incredible performance. I love it and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Superb alternative to more-expensive Dremel, while fully functional with most Dremel accessories.
customer_reviews.text: *Really* handy tool. Fits almost all Dremel accessories. I don't think I've taken the Flex Shaft off once since I've had it... just TOO handy. For small guitar electronics work (fitting/expanding cavities, modifying parts), this couldn't be handier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Loving it - does all that its more expensive cousin does, at a bargain
customer_reviews.text: What attracted me most is the price. I have the Dremel - but their initial high price and pay as you go for every little thing policy does not sustain attraction. The WEN though - it does everything right off the box, it comes with a flex shaft, so handling is a breeze (one wishes there was a specific pistol grip available for this - I did manage to buy one from China via eBay for about 4 bucks). Other than that, this is very handy - MUCH quieter than the Dremel and operates like a breeze. It came in 2 days. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: SKID NY

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I have used several different rotary tools (mostly Dremal brand) but this blows any others i have used out of the water! Great tool and great price! I do however recomend getting some different acessories the ones included in this kit such as the grinding bits and cutting wheels are not very high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Looney

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 I spent all year
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life. Buy this one. For $20 bucks you get everything you need. Just spent an hour engraving keys, phones, ipads, etc. Very powerful. I only turned it up to level 4. It goes up to like 8!!!! My wife saw me open this and said what the heck, did you spent $100 on that, I said no $20, she had nothing else to say after that. Far beyond my expectations for the price. Solid construction. Solid tight fittings. I wish I would have bought this 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Bonobo Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Clamping chuck bore size is too big & stiff , it can not hold grinding shafts
customer_reviews.text: This tool holding chuck bore size is too big & not flexible so that it can not firmly hold the grinding shafts (shaft will spin). I damage the tool trying to tighten the chuck (stripped threads). I tried to return the tool but seller does not want the damaged tool and credit back my purchase amount. I have no use of this tool. If seller could correct the chuck bore size & made it flexible , it would be a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: GL313

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value. I have a NiCad-type cordless Dremel which works for about 30 seconds before it dies (the battery is a goner). I needed a much stronger motor to cut through the rusted parts of dishwasher racks. Not only does this device work well, but it includes a flexible coil extension. Without the extension, the job would have been much harder to accomplish. I don't like the product being from China, as with almost every durable good I have purchased in the past ten years. It undercuts Dremel prices in a major way. But the cost of a similar setup on Dremel is beyond my budget for this project.
customer_reviews.author: DJL

customer_reviews.title: Overheated right away
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a nice rotary tool. Well packaged and lots of extras. The problem was that it became super hot aftera short time using so I unplugged and let cool. After that the speed control would not work so I chatted with Amazon product support. They refunded my purchase and had me dispose of the tool to avoid any issues.
customer_reviews.author: RV Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is amazing. I bought a mask and goggles and spent 3 hours just cutting into and etching things. Things tested on: -Glass shot glass -Tin can -Bullet casing -Graham cracker I played with all kinds of different tips to see what they did. I checked the manual for tips it accepted and got 20 more at the hardware store for $4. I'm not sure how long you're supposed to use it, though, as after 3 hours I noticed the rubber (I was using the pen/hose/extender/thing) started melting from the extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Daaku026

customer_reviews.title: Worst BATTERY Life I’ve seen
customer_reviews.text: This rotary machine is troubling. Yes the price is reasonable, and the built-in LED light is incredibly useful. However my main issue with this machine is the battery life. It takes about an hour, hour and a half, to charge. THEN it takes maybe 45 minutes to an hour of use. All while this is happening, the machine is slowly starting to overheat. The machine is reasonably powerful but I dare to rarely, if ever, use the max power because this brand is prone to overheating and breaking down. I can’t recommend this product. I’m actually going to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: BluRayGuy

customer_reviews.title: Why am I shopping Amazon if this is the best they can do
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool for a total of about 20 minutes-then the speed control went out. It will run at slow speed or high speed, nothing in between. I contacted amazon and am told that this item is ineligible for return, even though it says it is eligible for return up to Feb. 23rd. Today is Feb. 10th. Why am I shopping Amazon if this is the best they can do? At least at the big box stores I could return a defective item. Also, I won't buy another WEN tool-----ever!
customer_reviews.author: dwoo l 44

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Super surprised at the performance. I was torn between buying a Dremel and this, because I didn’t know how good I would be at metalsmithing. It’s been a few months and this is holding up very well and works great with out fail. I’m very happy I choose this over the very expensive Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Meh at most
customer_reviews.text: Got this tool last year and used it a few times. It's MEH at most. It is EXTREMELY under-powered - I tried cutting a cardboard core and the tool was struggling and grunting and stalling. Pathetic, if you ask me. Definitely not balanced well, you can feel the vibrations even without any tool in the collar. Overall, it's good if you have double the time to get something done and that something does't require any precision. Personally, I wish I could return it and get something more powerful and better balanced.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vishnevsky

customer_reviews.title: Blows away my old RTX
customer_reviews.text: I first had a B&D RTX and it was amazing for 5 years so when it died I bought a 2nd one, big mistake, it lasted maybe a month. They are not as quality as they use to be. This Wen was such a better value, especially coming with the flexible shaft connector. The torque is not quite as strong as the RTX but this one is outlasting my last RTX and the flex shaft is so nice to own. I have been using this with carbon fiber discs to clean out grout joints and help wit tile install.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Broken Flex shaft after one use!
customer_reviews.text: I finally wore out my dremel after many years of use. I use this type of tool a lot around my house. Dremel's are expensive, so i thought i would try this one. It works well; however, the flex shaft has already broken!!! After first use. Not sure if I'll send it back or just suck it up and buy another one. Dremel typical accessories work with this thing. The unit itself seems to work okay. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Alton

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Bf was excited, finally pulled it down n used it since Christmas, he used the wire brush. As I sit here he is handing me the bristles off the brush attachment. Got to wondering y it wasn't doing anything n turned it off and there were no wire bristles anymore. He now looks like a porccipine lol other than that good power, bf is happy, minus plucking the wires put of his jacket, pants, hat, and face...
customer_reviews.author: nay

customer_reviews.title: Flexible shaft is.. well.. flexible (versatile)
customer_reviews.text: This works just like you would expect any rotary tool to. The thing is, some fall short in various different areas, so the fact that this tool just works and does everything that you expect from it is a plus, not just a neutral! The flexible shaft is very versatile and makes it very easy to use this tool without having to attempt to hold It in uncomfortable ways. Overall works great and have zero complaints about it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ashby Technologies

customer_reviews.title: Will not turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I received this tool on Nov 14 and on Nov 15 I unboxed it and checked it out to be sure it would operate OK. It was fine. I put it back in the case. Dec 1 I removed it from the case and it would not turn on. I tried it in other sockets but it just would not run. I called amazon and they said they would send me a replacement. I hope it works OK. Great service from Amazon. Good reason to buy here.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Just like that "other" tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my oldest daughter to enable her to trim/grind her dog's nails. It looks and operates just like that name brand that costs more money. My daughter says this tool works great and wishes she had bought an electric model over her old battery operated one years ago. I gave this four stars as I'm not sure of its dependability. If it lasts as long as my rebranded Craftsman model then it's a FIVE star for sure. And the added "Flex Shaft" adds even more value to this set. Overall very pleased with this unit, especially its price point here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months now and have had no issues with it. I have used it on wood and stone, as well as polishing metal. Like most people mention, the accessories that come with it are decent but not great. You will probably want to buy some separately but everything else about this Dremel is great. I have never used any of the expensive dremels out there so I don't know how it compares to those but for my needs, which is more hobbies, its been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Powerful with great versatility
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes with everything you need to get started working on whatever project you've been planning. The tips are easy to change, and the variety of head makes this a very useful tool for do it your self and home craft projects. The power is easily adjustable, and can increase based on your need. I've used it for cutting, sanding, cleaning and filing. I had no idea how many different things I could do with this tool. If you use it heavily, you will need to purchase new tips as they do wear out faster with more use. A handy storage case is included to keep all of the accessories organized together with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Jordan

customer_reviews.title: a lot for the money but not high quality
customer_reviews.text: this is a very light weight tool, on low speeds it does not have the torque to do the job that a higher priced tool will. You get a lot of toys but missing some important ones and the quality of the attachments are average. I use the cut off wheel often, luckily I had the quick connect version that dremmel puts out because this just has the old type that does not attach as well. The big complaint is the case. It is poorly made and broke after a few uses. Just give me a soft case with a place to store attachments vs. this fancy case that was designed for the sale vs. use.
customer_reviews.author: scottatl

customer_reviews.title: Look alike Dremel, but I thinka  better value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set and works equally well. In fact, my buddies saw what I bought and they in turn each order the same set. This set has everything you'll need. Extension flexible cable makes easy work in tight spaces. The main tool has a scatter shield, an LED light so when you’re up close and working the business end is illuminated. All in all a super buy at about $35.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a corded because it suited my needs a bit better in terms of power need; this is great with the variable speed options. It's light weight, easy to use and I like the detachable handle, it makes it a lot easier to work with. All of the attachments are nice, and the storage case makes it easy to keep everything together. I would highly recommend getting the key-less chuck for it, it makes this an amazing tool to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Gauge

customer_reviews.title: Works Mostly Ok
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to sand some corbels for above the stove. From the first time I used it I found that it randomly shuts off or just won't turn on. Fortunately, just flipping the switch to off and then back on again has remedied this. It's not from overheating as up until last night I was using it only in short sessions (1-2 min). Last night I used it for a good 20 min nonstop and it worked well the whole time. The speed on it good as I've only needed to use it on its lowest setting and that's a little too much. The pen accessory is nice and allows me to sand the small details quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: BMW

customer_reviews.title: Look nice but not meant to be used anything over a light use..
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a wonderful tool, but I have had to replace it twice in a year. It made a sound like a pop and now the replacement is dead. I liked the box that it came with and the options seem to make it a great tool. Just for some reason it is not built for moderate to heavy use. My fathers Dremel has been a working like a champ for 20 years. The tool just did not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Moses Nijmeh

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable chuck lock & overheats.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is garbage. Seems like a great deal, but the build quality is awful. First time i used it the chuck locking pin stopped working and the included wrench failed. It's a 10 mm so not s huge deal on the wrench. But the chuck pin literally splits the unit in half while you try to tighten it. It entirely failed so bad i had to buy a new unit and went with Dremel ®.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for maybe four projects in just under the 3 years I've owned it. Now the collet is stripped so it only tightens enough to use larger diameter bits, and even still it vibrates atrociously which makes it impossible to cut anything with a Dremel cutting bit. I kinda expected that at the very low barrier-of-entry so I'm not upset, but I would definitely recommend people hold out for when an actual Dremel goes on sale instead of buying this. You will find a million uses for this, it will fail, and you will end up buying a Dremel in the end anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this tool. The first one I used for 2-3 years until the flex shaft became a little frayed at the tip and would not spin consistently. However, i think I got a tremendous amount of use from this tool before that happened. I looked to purchase jut the shaft, but they were $14. I was able to get this new unit for $20. Tiy cant beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstein Howell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and solid tool, very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: 20 year old dremel finally went to the rotary tool graveyard....RIP. Bought this as a temp pretty much based on the price. Very surprised when I opened it. How the neck do you make something like this for $25??? SOLID TOOL! The freebie bits are so so and the pen does have quite a bit of runout, but it works. The good news is my dermal pen (no runout) and all bits and attachments work! The only item that doesn't fit so far is the collet nut, collets themselves fit perfect. I can live with that.I Oh, and the case is junk...but I didn't buy it for the case
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bowen

customer_reviews.title: I must say both product and seller are amazing. I love my rotary
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I also purchased the Dremel Plung Router 335-01 kit, and it works AWESOME!!! I’ve carved twice now with it and both products are great as a start for making wood signs. I’d recommend purchasing both these items if you want to practice and try signs before spending hundreds of dollars on an actual Router. I must say both product and seller are amazing. I love my rotary. Thank you Amazon.com LLC for being so generous and kind. My carving isn't perfect since this is my first time working with one, but it's so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Chuck/ Collet bore not concentric
customer_reviews.text: Not good at all... I like the concept, but the tool is severely flawed. The chuck has lots of runout, so the bits aren't concentric. They wobble. This is unacceptable for this type of tool. The tool bogs and shuts down pretty easily, it doesn't have very much torque at all. I was using a saw bit to cut plastic and the tool shut off multiple times. Ended up using my 14 dollar Black & Decker rotary tool and it powered through no problem. If the chuck was so off center, I'd say this thing would be awesome for doing fingernails or some other extremely light duty work. But not for any real work or even crafting
customer_reviews.author: Squeaky Huevos

customer_reviews.title: 😎👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! For $25 you can’t go wrong....and since I didn’t buy the $134 Dremel kit with the flex shaft I still have $109 to spend on something else. 😎👍🏻 I wanted a Dremel, but I realized that I will only use a rotary tool for a few small projects so I went for this one. A warning tag on the cord specifies that the coil on the inside of the flex shaft should be greased after several minutes of use. I pulled it out and greased it before I even turned it on since some reviewers complained of the flex shaft getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool, wobbly flex shaft
customer_reviews.text: This is better than the Chicago Electric rotary tool. Maybe that's not saying much but the basic tool is pretty good. It's balanced ok and the collet lock works well (common shortcoming on these machines it seems). The issue I have is with the flex shaft. I wasn't expecting Dremel quality here, but the face of the collet chuck is visibly out of round and it causes a lot of wobble when a tool is mounted in the flex head. If the flex shaft was totally useable if a bit wimpy I would call this a screaming deal. As it is, it's just ok since the tool itself is at least solid.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Newcome

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful tool. Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rotary tool. I purchased this to replace an old variable speed dremel. I over tightened the collet on that one and now it wont tighten like it should. My initial impression of this tool is very good. It comes with a large number of accessories including the flex tool for around $20. What a great value. For the weekend hobbiest or handyman I would say th his is more than adequate. It has plenty of power and is able to do everything my dremel could do. Sure the dremel was a little higher in quality and a little more refined, but this works just fine. I'm certainly pleased with my purchase and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: ImJoeMan

customer_reviews.title: Tool apparently stripped out inside, will not rotate attachments when the workpiece is contacted.
customer_reviews.text: Tool apparently stripped out inside, will not rotate/stops attachments when the workpiece is contacted. I got this to use in place of a Dremel 7700-7.2v cordless, that got packed away/misplaced due to multiple water pipe breaks in the slab and everything getting packed up so the leaks could be repaired and the floors & walls replaced. I really miss the Dremel, it was a very sturdy & durable tool, the battery held a charge if not used for at least 7-10 months if you removed from the tool. I will probably need to buy another Dremel cordless; they seem to have moved onto 8v or 12v
customer_reviews.author: jlm

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my wife and was suprised at the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife to use on her crafts i already had a dremel but we some times needed it at the same time was very suprised at the power and quality right there with my dremel and takes the same bits the rottary extension needs a little work but everything else has been great.
customer_reviews.author: bradley berreth

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are on a strict budget I highly recommend that you do not buy this product. Go ahead and invest another $20 or $30 to get a machine that is worth your time. The one I received had a problem with the rod remaining steady while spinning and caused 2 pieces to vibrate uncontrollably and break in a violent fashion, sending metal flying across my yard. This happened the 2nd time even at a lower speed. Tried using the extension and it wouldn't even stay connected. Total waste of money. Also the stabilizing handle snapped off within the first 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tylersmithawake

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, though i haven't gotten the flex shaft to work. I just need to read the directions. I like that it's pretty quiet. I got an easy change chuck which makes things even simpler to use. Oh, one thing that's annoying is you have to use the "L" tool to screw and unscrew the chuck on the flex shaft. I wish there was a button like on the base tool because i know I'll lose this L tool. Luckily other things work, I used a pliers once, but I still wish it had a button.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon...
customer_reviews.text: The tool is a good price for what you get but, after installing the flex shaft, I found that the flex shaft lock was defective and the flex shaft cable was now permanently installed. (Flex shaft lock button is stuck and will not budge). Very disappointed that I can't use this the way it is intended. Guess I got a lemon for the majority of people who buy this are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Hands

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great rotary tool. I really put this through its paces maching a block of aluminum. I ran this for a couple hours straight at a time with a milling bit without issue. I really expected to have problems using it that hard continously, but it didnt overheat or bog down. For being a third of the price of the other brand I was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: What I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was sanding small parts with the flexible drive using the brand that comes to mind when you think of rotary tools. It was very old and gave out. Looking at $100 up to replace it was hard to justify. The price was right on this one and it does a great job. I no longer do as much of this work so it should be great for years to come and there when I need it. UPDATE: I had a problem with the collet nut so I let them know and they sent me another one. Great service. I would definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: David_De

customer_reviews.title: Beats Dremel Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cordless Dremel that I use to grind down the puppies nails. I went electric because after going thru 2 cordless dremels, I refuse to waste my money on another one. My dog is very good about laying down to get his nails trimmed but has always hated it. When I used this for the first time, he was significantly more comfortable laying there than he ever was with the Dremel Cordless. I am super happy I bought this! The only regret I have is that I didn't buy one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this asks about the battery life as it's a corded Dremel there is no battery however at extremely durable I am a dog groomer I use it daily my first one lasted for years and I just had to replace it great value for the money. I used to go through several dremals a year of the battery operated come
customer_reviews.author: Kelz TLC Grooming

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to complete a project when my Dremel went on the fritz. Perfectly serviceable for the price. Fit and finish is not up to Dremel, but not bad either. Power is good and vibration is minimal. Pretty much a copy of the original Dremel design. The steel bits included are the only disappointment. They dulled quickly and became unusable. haven't used the stones or discs, so cant comment. Overall its a good value for the price. I paid around twenty dollars delivered. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It melted not even a week after purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Upon putting it together, the tightening tool provided was not enough to tighten the bit in properly. So after finding a strong enough tool in our possession, we got the bit on. We used it for maybe 30 seconds and the bit snaps in half. We expected that considering the price. The part that really upsets me is that maybe on my 3rd time using the flex shaft, the sheathing that covers it started smoking and melted off and apart. Right around where the protective coils are where it connets to the tool itself. I know I didnt put much money into this, but I totally expected to get a little more use out of this. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: I loved it.....while it worked. I purchased Mine about 9 months ago and used it about once every three weeks to shape my dog’s toenails after clipping them. It was not strenuous or lengthy work. Though it normally held a charge very well suddenly doesn’t seem to be charging and I can’t get information on what the beep and blue light mean when I try to turn it on now. When I plug it in it appears to be charged. Frustrating as it’s otherwise a GREAT tool.
customer_reviews.author: UnRuli

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Dremel
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to actually replace a dremel pet nail trimmer that burnt out too quickly. This has been holding strong and working great on both big and small dog paws alike. I have also found myself using this over my comparable Dremel for more situations than I initially thought. Primarily its due to the quick collet change ability , light on the end(came in handy more than I thought initially), charges faster and runs longer. The price point,features and reliability sold me on it and I haven't looked to buy another Dremel to replace the last one. I will keep buying WEN moving forward for battery powered dremels and tools
customer_reviews.author: CNK American

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Motor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the WEN 23114 1.4-Amp rotary tool, and have used it for a couple of projects already. It does come with some accessory bits, but I also have a pretty comprehensive set of bits & other accessories. The flex-shaft I immediately disassembled & liberally coated the shaft with quality grease and reassembled. They never put enough grease inside, and the shaft will get extremely hot and bind up, etc. This is from past experience with other rotary tools flex-shaft attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Average_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Okay for occasional use. Slight wobble.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for various DIY projects. Mainly for cutting and shaping plastic. The overall feel of the item is okay, consistent with the price point. There's a slight wobble in the shaft on the main unit. It was noticeable at speed setting 3. It can go much higher but due to the noise level and wobble at setting 3, I did not want to go higher. I used the flexible extension with the cutting disk and sanding drum to cut thick plastic bins. It worked well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just days past the thirty day return period.
customer_reviews.text: Less than two weeks past the date eligible to return the unit. Purchased the Square Trade Warranty just in case but it does not take effect until AFTER the manufacturer warranty which is a year BUT they don't pay shipping either way. Basically it will cost more in shipping then to purchase new and the warranty is absolutely a waste since it won't make it past the year manufacturer warranty. We have purchased in the past and they don't last so this time thought we were ahead of the game with the warranty but ended up learning the hard way that rather than just being out for the product, we are out for the warranty too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Minten

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool for all you diy guys and gals
customer_reviews.text: This tool is fun. I originally got as recomended for an auto repair job. Then soon realized I like useing this tool for all sorts of things. I tinker with electronics and this with a wire brush attachment makes cleaning up boasts a breeze. Like others I too am seeing a not so happy flex drive though the chuck end wobbles some and came off changing a bit. I also wish the flex was a little bit longer. Power? Plenty of power to spare. I wish it would run slower sometimes. The variable adjust works fine. I think I'll try a foot pedal switch to remote the on/off For the price, It's awesome
customer_reviews.author: Timathie Eisenga

customer_reviews.title: Shaft is not centered perfectly, also flex shaft broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I first tired using this with the flex shaft. It seemed to work for a little while, then stopped working completely. I tested without the flex shaft, and when testing this rotary tool, it seems like the motor shaft is off center slightly, so that every attachment you use wobbles slightly. This is pretty frustrating. I wasn't able to return it, so eventually had to just throw it away. You might want to look for a more expensive rotary tool.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: Could really use some more low-powered settings once you apply a little bit of pressure power bogs down and as soon as a little pressure is taken off it spins incredibly fast some low-powered settings with enough power to actually drive them at that speed would be optimum also when tightening the bits the whole mechanism spreads apart and the depth setter mix literally no sense or was installed or manufactured backwards have used wen products before never had a problem with them this is pretty much garbage
customer_reviews.author: robert clayton

customer_reviews.title: Have to replace
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a while. Though the bits were garbage the tool itself was really powerful and easy to use. I only used it with the flex shaft and that was really great. After a few months the collet quit gripping anything. I thought it was the flex shaft so bought another one. Nope. It’s the collet on the tool itself. I can’t use either the flex shaft or put bits directly on the tool. I have no idea what happened. For a twenty dollar tool it was surprisingly good for a few months, but now I need to buy another tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Big time saver
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove two bolts and nuts on my lawn tractor locate in a hard to reach spot. Both were rusted and jammed. I tried the usual tricks to no avail. So I bought this thinking even if I use it only to cut bolts it is worth it given how cheaply priced it is. And I was right. I needed a few blades to cut the bolts due to the weird angle I was operating in but there were plenty of them. Now I have plenty of other accessories to use. Just need an opportunity!
customer_reviews.author: martyhike

customer_reviews.title: but it gets the job done and the price is fantastic. The remote attachment is worth the price on ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent little product for the cost. Has a lot of vibration compared to my Dremel and you'd definitely know which one was the name brand, but it gets the job done and the price is fantastic. The remote attachment is worth the price on its own as it also fits my dremel. It does tend to wrap up under torque, which the dremel brand does not, but again for the money you can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Dremel...
customer_reviews.text: While looking to get a rotary tool I came across this little guy after reading the blazing reviews. Having no previous experience in looking for a sanding tool I didn't even really know what I wanted. So like always I starting doing my research and found the great reviews on this site, but on top of that watched 2 separate video reviews that rated this the #2 best rotary tool of 2017. So it's not cordless, so what, the flex shaft will get you the extension that you need. Nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kachi's Kid

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced rotary tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rotary tool kit with flex shaft to use on my toenails and my dogs toe nails. Unfortunately, my toe nails get thick and hard to cut out so I use the grinder. I use the lowest speed and let it run for few minutes before I start using it per instructions. I use the paper sander that fits over rubber base. Of course, It includes many other attachments that are useful for many other purposes but those are for another review.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes with the reviews for this tool
customer_reviews.text: The kit comes with plenty of accessories and the tool has high speed. Only negative was the flex tool. It broke during first use. The way it attaches to the actual tool causes it to fail. If you're not going to use the flex tool this is a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SRAD

customer_reviews.title: 1.4 amp version is disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Product has a lot of good reviews. The jumble them all together though. This 1.4 amp product is disappointing. The on off switch doesn't work now and then so not sure about that. The shaft has too much wobble. On higher speed the tool vibrates so bad it is very uncomfortable to hold. On high speed it is extremely loud at a high pitch that sounds like a siren. I had a rotary tool from harbour freight I liked better than this. I'm probably going to be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better than Dremel!
customer_reviews.text: This rotary device is perfect! No need to spend so much money on the Dremel brand when you can get better quality right here with this one. My Dremel finally gave out after about 10 years and I really didn’t want to spend so much money on a new one. Found this one and so very happy with it. I think it performs better than my old Dremel. Plus the flex cable which I never had before, makes getting into tight spaces so easy. High recommended!
customer_reviews.author: _steev_o_

customer_reviews.title: Overall, for the price, this is an awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, seems cheap, but it's lasted as long as my last Dremel brand. Switch and speed control on handle, kind of a pain to find/reach when you need to shut off fast, but it works as intended so can't really fault that. I got lucky and ended up with a good one, with Chinese tools, it's a crapshoot, but test thoroughly as soon as you get and promptly send back (free) if it has any issues. Don't wait a month...
customer_reviews.author: TRJ

customer_reviews.title: Wen Tool for Dog Toenail Clipper
customer_reviews.text: I was advised to purchase a Wen by a friend, both for its great cost savings and its great quality. My friend was so right! I needed a rotary tool for doggie toenail trimming and it is so great! Has every bit style that I well ever need; it is cordless; and almost completely silent! My little dog girl had no problem with the experience - she was very calm and accepting and it did a GREAT JOB on her dagger toenails!!!!! Excellent buy in every respect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Penny J. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome!  The flex shaft is a good touch.  Its quiet and had the power I need.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rotary tool at a good price. I was using my original dremel drill even with it being somewhat screwed up for awhile because I thought I'd have to spend $75-100 for a new one. Well, after I decided I needed a new one and checked prices, I was surprised to find this one. It really met my expectations of price and functionality. All of my Dremel bits work with it just fine. I had a little problem with the flex shaft coming off, but that might not be the device's fault. I don't really need it all that much. But, I definitely recommend this rotary tool, its pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Defective flex shaft
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately the wand became very hot. The flex shaft stopped working after 2 hours. I was only interested in using the flex shaft. The basic unit still works but is of no use to me. I replaced entire unit with a D*****.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Of course I'm comparing this to a Dremmel. I didn't have the highest expectations for this thing. I thought it would get me through a few jobs and then, at this price, I can buy another and still be under what a Dremmel would cost. I have loved this thing. I can't kill it. Only one caveat I would give is the "carbon" blades they send with it are less than worthless. Hardened paper material or something. Breaks apart at the least amount of pressure. Get you another set of these and you be ready to do some cutting.
customer_reviews.author: kenh

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Flex shaft broke as soon as I used it, but apparently I can't return it/get a replacement so I'm stuck with this thing. Beyond that though, the machine itself works fine. I've been using it with bits ordered separately, but they fit in the machine and do their job. If you need a cheap rotary tool, this does the job, but if you're looking specifically for a rotary tool with a flex shaft you should find a higher quality one.
customer_reviews.author: yeehaw cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value great for jewelry students just starting
customer_reviews.text: It is working well for my jewelry making as I can not afford the very expensive flex shaft device most use. The only real difference is that you must control everything with the speed roller and the on off switch instead of a foot pedal which is by no means a fault of the device just something to be aware of. It has really been very nice to use and a great help! Can not beat the value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: entropy

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: The cutting wheels are super fragile and one immediately broke as soon as I tried to use it. The extension, while easy to attach, did not work: I think the internal wire may have broken. The instructions are incomplete and hard to read (I have never used a Dremmel, so I actually needed the instructions). The instructions come on two different sheets, and one of them was printed backwards and therefore difficult to read (should I have tried reading through a mirror?) Low quality product. The price is very good, but considering what you actually get for your $20, of marginal value.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: Too good, one of the best purchases I've ever made. Ordered sat. arrived Sun. so that I could finish my project. This kit has all that I need and I found that I had eleven old bits that I've never used that will fit in it. Comes with two collets for small and larger bits and even a couple drill bits. Not recommended for everyday use but just right for my needs. I just laid the motor down and use the cable like a large pencil to grind out the slot for my computer tower USB 3.1 type C front panel connection. Really an incredible value for the money and with Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Wen is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This is great value for the money! You will not regret this! It works amazing, comes with plenty of attachments and also works with other brands of attachments. The flex shaft attachment is just too sweet to resist as well. You owe it to yourself to try it. Great quality and great price. Wen has done a great job. Only problem I have had is that the flex shaft started vibrating pretty hard out of nowhere, but after I removed and reattached the shaft, problem was solved.
customer_reviews.author: NMBowser

customer_reviews.title: Quality control and durability issues, can’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So, this worked ok at first, but soon had issues with the chuck not gripping bits unless really torqued. This is with multiple bits, which all worked with other rotary tools. I replaced the chuck with an adjustable one, which also started having gripping issues fairly soon. The last straw is that the flexible shaft that came in the kit doesn’t actually fit onto the tool, it won’t screw on because the the female threads on the shaft are a smaller diameter that the male threads on the tool. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ross

customer_reviews.title: Flex cable broke
customer_reviews.text: I tried attaching the flex cable and it came apart. I go to return it within Amazon's 30 day period and was told it was not eligible for return. Do not buy!!! I double checked the product page and it doesn't say anything about a different return policy for this item.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Right for the price and simple projects!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap dremmel to sand down some metal on a dirb bike lever to get it to fit into the clamp on the master cylinder. This fit the bill for the price and ground the metal down enough to fit. Downside is that the bits are pretty flimsy and cheap, so you'll likely want to buy more as I had to do as the toughest one wore out after the 1 use tho it was a piece of metal I was grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Daniels

customer_reviews.title: the carry case and flex shaft is a nice addition to this product
customer_reviews.text: iv only used this product once but for the price point you are definitely just buying the rotary tool itself and not the attachments. the attachments you can tell are obviously cheap knock offs of quality products. some attachments are ok such as the bits and grinding stones. the cut off and sanding wheels are extremely brittle. i accidently dropped a few of the cut off wheels before use from just a few inches and they shattered upon impact. the carry case and flex shaft is a nice addition to this product. i would recommend buying after market addition bits, grinders, cut off wheels, etc from a well known name like dremel for quality attachments to use with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hobbyists
customer_reviews.text: Used this to get a stuck plastic bolt off of a metal screw. Did the job but blades shattered when it hit the metal screw a couple of times. I found Dremel brand blades which are reinforced and look much sturdier, and appear to fit. Lots of versatility with this tool. Great for hobbyists, diy crafts, etc. I am thinking about using this whenever I get around to painting miniatures for games. It could remove excess flash (plastic from the mold cast, sprues), etc. This is an economical Dremel style solution that has plenty of power and also has the flex shaft for more control or for use in tough to reach places.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this thing to do one thing--do cutting on one small project. Kit delivered with everything included with one thing missing---the three cutting pieces that are supposed to be included in the kit are missing. So, out I go to my local store to buy the missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R.

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm this thing is freaken awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this without having any idea how to use it or any drill/tool experience. I needed something to put holes in seashells so I could make a wind chime. Well this tool has by far exceeded my expectations. It works wonderfully to put small holes in my shells without breaking them!!! Yipeeee! To do that I change the collet to the smaller one that comes in the little accessory box and insert the smallest of the two drill bits into that. It does take a little patience but works great! I am also using this for several other crafting projects. How did I live so long without one of these in my life??!!!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: kbc77

customer_reviews.title: If it works but you can’t use it because they don’t come with the right tools or parts.
customer_reviews.text: The WEN is easy to hold, not too heavy, and I would have given it a higher rating BUT!!! All the collets (the little part in the cap that holds the bits) are too large and only holds 1 or 2 of the bits they provide. I work on plastic models and the limited options leaves me unsatisfied. I had to ask around since I needed a smaller collet that will fit the rotary tool and made another deprecate purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TommyTea

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful rotary tool..well made and at a terrific price. Great tool for any shop with flex shaft included.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the money....I noticed a small amount of vibration and just a wee bit of runout at the very highest speeds. If you use it with the included flex shaft cable it works really great. The little accessory pack that comes with it leaves something to be desired and is nothing to write home about. Any other dremel accessory works with this tool so there's plenty of better quality cut off wheels , buffing wheels, and sanding drums etc available. For the price it's a great tool to have in the shop compared to the higher priced other brand. HIGHLY recommended
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fried

customer_reviews.title: Minor issue once resolved a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same Dremel since I was 17. I'm about 60 now so I'm amazed it still ran. Grudgingly. This was to cheap to be any good but I was very wrong. It is a very good unit. I did have a off center chuck on the flex unit. I called the cust service#. I was surprised they said we'll send another without a return-I had already managed to re-pack in the factory manner & that's not easy. The 2nd unit ran true & is a step up and a half from my old unit. Smoother & a lot less noise. Very good for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Carl in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and great price
customer_reviews.text: this rotary tool is much better than the dremel I had and it costs much less. It has a lot of power and the flex shaft makes it really easy to use in places where it's hard to fit the actual rotary tool. I've used it for my dogs nails too and it's great. I turned up the speed a little and it filed down their nails quick. With the flex shaft I was able to set down the rotary part and they were not at all bothered and it was quieter for them. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Road

customer_reviews.title: This works great for getting into right spaces for final cleanup
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th rotary tool I've purchased but the first I've actually used. I watched a utube video! I'm a novice wood Carver and I needed a tool to keep with my flexcut carving tools. This works great for getting into right spaces for final cleanup. I need to purchase wood specific bits to make it more useable. Love the shaft. Only issue is that bits keep loosening. I would recommend for inexpensive back up. Case is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off and changes speed on its own
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself and used it as soon as it came in and LOVED IT. Loved it so much I bought one for my dad the same day. Went to use it the next day and it wouldn't turn on 😒. Needless to say I was a little frustrated. It has two black circle plastic things on it (not sure what they are for) I kinda pressed it and it turned on. But as I'm using it it still turns off. Also the speed will change on its own without adjusting the dial while using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Gronus

customer_reviews.title: Over heated fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all the great reviews for my boyfriend. This overheated within 2 or 3 minutes to the point where it was very hot to the touch. We had to wait till it cooled off before it was put back in the case, which also was junk. We bought the tool with with the flex drive and it would not fit in the case, you will want to throw the case away if you keep it. I did like the full range variable rpm's, the extension and the mess of bits and cutters that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who are looking for a rotary tool kit without the fluff and big brand name.
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted one of these buy did not want to pay top dollar to own a name brand rotary tool. If you agree with that statement you will be more than happy to own one of these. So many applications open up and the world has new meaning when you can engrave and shape that thing you always thought needed it. A great little kit that has enabled me to do all the little fixed and changes I wanted to but was unable because I am cheap. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: As good as Dremel  at a fraction of the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for my Dremel, which unfortunately burnt out. With the high cost of Dremel, and how quickly it became a useless paperweight, the Wen rotary tool seemed it would be worth a shot. So far, I am very happy that I went with the Wen. This rotary tool has worked as expected. It had performed as well, or better than my corded Dremel tool. Much more affordable than my Dremel, so if this one does end up burning out like my Dremel, it won’t be such a disappointment. In fact I’d probably buy another.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherEarthling

customer_reviews.title: Just as Good as the D Brand
customer_reviews.text: Very good rotary tool and much less expensive than the D brand. I use it for hobby use so I don't know how it would hold up for every day use. The flex shaft works very well and makes using it in small spaces or on small objects much easier. The controls or well placed and easy to increase speed as needed. There is a fair assortment of bits, but if you are like me you will be getting more for different use.
customer_reviews.author: JWC

customer_reviews.title: great rotary tool for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great rotary tool. I wanted to try glass etching, but didn't want to spend a lot of money on a dremel, since I didn't know if I could do it. I am VERY pleased with his product. I have successfully etched multiple items easily without hand fatigue, I definately recommendthe flex shaft attachment. This model also fits other bits as long as they are for 1/8 inch collet. I buy discount bits at harbor freightand have not had any problems. The variable speeds are great for added control. I like the case so all the items are kept together.
customer_reviews.author: jch425

customer_reviews.title: Not all I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed. The main reason I went wit the Wen over the dremel was the lower price, but also the flex shaft attachment. The first problem is the flex shaft attachment and the main unit have different size bit holders. The smallest being on the main unit, so if you want to use the smallest drill bit, you cant. That doesn't really matter, becasue when I put in the larger bit, instead of spinning in a tight neat circle, the bit wobbled in much larger diameter. I have to assume the polishing bits, which are heavier, are what the flex shaft is designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Doro626

customer_reviews.title: Alot of BANG! for a little BUCK.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong! I have had this unit for several months and I have done several carving, cutting and grinding projects with it, and it performs. The included extras make it worth the purchase, and it does have away to select the speed, based on the material you are using. I recommend this unit, if you can not afford the Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Rochester B. Anderson

product_meta.title: WEN 2305 Rotary Tool Kit with Flex Shaft
product_meta.description:
Style:Corded BasicFROM THE MANUFACTURER
Rotary tools are one of the most flexible tools around. The WEN 2305 Rotary Tool Kit with Flex Shaft allows for precision details on your projects. You can polish, sand, grind, cut, drill, remove burrs and shape with this tool. Variable speed of 8,000 to 30,000 RPM with a powerful 1 AMP motor and double insulated for safety. If you can imagine it, this tool can achieve it. Clean and restore those older pieces of furniture. Add some interesting detail work to others. You can do cut outs in drywall, cabinets and more. Includes 80 accessories for all your cutting, grinding, polishing, sanding and drilling needs and conveniently stores in a custom case. Rating: 120V, 60Hz, AC only
feature_bullets: Perfect for cutting, sanding, polishing, shaping, drilling, deburring, grinding and more
Variable speed goes anywhere from 8,000 to 30,000 RPM
Includes a 100-piece accessory set of bits, sanding discs, polishing pads, mandrels and more
Onboard spindle lock makes for quick and easy bit changes. 2.3mm & 3.2mm collets
Attach the included flex shaft for jobs requiring intricate detail and precision

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars8,678 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
